rule.name: this
rule.doc:
Returns the value stored in current transformation context.
The root context has the value equals to input of transformation.
Each operation creates new context with value of its result.

rule.name: parent
rule.doc: Returns the value stored in previous context.

rule.name: item
rule.doc:
Works inside `map` rule when iterating over lists.
Returns current item.

rule.name: key
rule.doc:
Works inside `map` rule when iterating over dicts.
Returns the key of current element.

rule.name: index
rule.doc:
Works inside `map` rule.
Returns 0-based index of iteration.

rule.name: value
rule.doc:
Works inside `map` rule when iterating over dicts.
Returns the value of current element.

rule.name: set
rule.doc:
Stores the value in the context under given name.
You can consider this rule as variable assignment.
Variable will be accessible under that name in all underlying contexts.

examples.name: AttrDynamicReferenceMultipleNames
examples.doc:
Gets a list of values discovered in nested input structure of dicts with paths defined in input data.
List of paths may include any number of paths of any depth.

param.name: name
param.doc: Name of the variable. Can be dynamic.

rule.name: get
rule.doc:
Returns the value stored under given name.
Value may be stored in current context or in any previous contexts.

examples.name: AttrDynamicReferenceMultipleNames
examples.doc:
Gets a list of values discovered in nested input structure of dicts with paths defined in input data.
List of paths may include any number of paths of any depth.

param.name: name
param.doc: Name of the variable. Can be dynamic.

rule.name: attr
rule.doc:
Returns values of attribute or item from current value in context.
Can search in deeply nested structures with path.
If attribute is not present an exception will be thrown.

param.name: name
param.doc:
Name of attribute to search. 
It is possible to use a number as the name for items in arrays. 
Can be dynamic.

examples.name: AttrSimpleFixedName
examples.doc: Gets value from input `dict` by the name of attribute defined in template as constant value.

examples.name: AttrDynamicReferenceName1
examples.doc: Gets value from input `dict` by the name of attribute defined in different attribute of input data.

examples.name: AttrDynamicReferenceName2
examples.doc: Gets value from input `dict` by the name of attribute defined in different attribute of input data.

param.name: names
param.doc:
List of attribute names or indexes to search in nested structure. 
Can be dynamic.

examples.name: AttrSimpleFixedNames
examples.doc: Gets a list of values with 4 elements discovered in nested input structure of dicts with paths defined in template.

examples.name: AttrDynamicReferenceNames
examples.doc: Gets value from nested input structure of dicts with paths defined in different attribute of input data.

examples.name: AttrDynamicReferenceMultipleNames
examples.doc:
Gets a list of values discovered in nested input structure of dicts with paths defined in input data.
List of paths may include any number of paths of any depth.

rule.name: object
rule.doc:
Returns a dict with one item.
This is useful when you need dynamically named attributes.
If you need multiple attributes use `join` or `map`.
If `key` or `value` returns no result then the rule returns empty dict.

param.name: key
param.doc: Defines template for name of attribute.

param.name: value
param.doc: Defines template for value of attribute.

rule.name: map
rule.doc: Iterates over `list` or `dict` and produces new `dict` or `list` with items based on template.

param.name: item
param.doc: Defines template for items when producing the `list`

examples.name: AttrDynamicReferenceMultipleNames
examples.doc:
Gets a list of values discovered in nested input structure of dicts with paths defined in input data.
List of paths may include any number of paths of any depth.

examples.name: ChainWithAttr
examples.doc: Searching for values in nested structure with sequence of `attr` operations chained together.

param.name: items
param.doc: Defines templates for series of items when producing the `list`

param.name: key
param.doc: Defines template for key when producing the `dict`

param.name: value
param.doc: Defines template for value when producing the `dict`

rule.name: zip
rule.doc:
Works exactly like `zip` function in python.
Converts collection of lists into list of items.
Another way to think of `zip` is that it turns rows into columns, and columns into rows.
This is similar to transposing a matrix.

param.name: items
param.doc: Defines the list of lists

rule.name: file
rule.doc:
Writes a file using `write_file` delegate (a parameter to `Transformer` constructor).
This rule produces no result.
File will not be written if `name` or `content` returns no result.

param.name: name
param.doc: Defines template for file name

param.name: content
param.doc: Defines template for file content. File content always has JSON formatted data

rule.name: join
rule.doc:
Joins (concatenates) together several dicts, lists of strings.
If items to be concatenated have different types an exception will be thrown.

param.name: items
param.doc: List of values to concatenate.

param.name: sep
param.doc: Defines separator for strings concatenation.

rule.name: chain
rule.doc:
Function composition operation.
Build function composition and executes it against value in current context.
`chain(f1, f2, f3)(x) === f3(f2(f1(x)))`

Each function execution creates new context that will be passed to next function.
```plantuml
@startuml
left to right direction
rectangle this
rectangle "intermediate context" as i1
rectangle "intermediate context" as i2
rectangle result
this --> i1: f1
i1 --> i2: f2
i2 --> result: f3
@enduml
```

examples.name: AttrDynamicReferenceMultipleNames
examples.doc:
Gets a list of values discovered in nested input structure of dicts with paths defined in input data.
List of paths may include any number of paths of any depth.

examples.name: ChainWithAttr
examples.doc: Searching for values in nested structure with sequence of `attr` operations chained together.

param.name: funcs
param.doc: Define list of templates (not just rules) for chaining

rule.name: expr
rule.doc:
Executes unary or binary operation.
There are 3 modes of running this rule:

1. **No attributes specified:**
Result is unary operation calculation against current context value.
2. **Single `value` specified:**
Result is binary operation calculation where the
first argument is current values of context and
the second is specified value.
3. **Multiple `values` specified:**
Result is calculated by applying operation to all values in pairs (reduction).
In this case current context value is ignored.

param.name: op
param.doc:
Defines name of operation. This is always constant.

###### Possible values:

| operator     | alternative | kind   | types          | result         |
|--------------|-------------|--------|----------------|----------------|
| <            | lt          | binary | any            | boolean        |
| <=           | le          | binary | any            | boolean        |
| ==           | eq          | binary | any            | boolean        |
| !=           | ne          | binary | any            | boolean        |
| >=           | ge          | binary | any            | boolean        |
| >         | gt          | binary | any            | boolean        |
| +            | add         | binary | string, number | string, number |
| -            | sub         | binary | number         | number         |
| *            | mul         | binary | number         | number         |
| /            | div         | binary | number         | number         |
| %            | mod         | binary | number         | number         |
| &&           | and         | binary | boolean        | boolean        |
| || | or          | binary | boolean        | boolean        |
| !            | not         | unary  | boolean        | boolean        |

You can use code-style or mnemonic name (i.e. operator or alternative).

param.name: value
param.doc: Defines template for single parameter value

param.name: values
param.doc: Defines template for multiple parameters values
